briefTitle: The Efficacy and Safety Study of TORIPALIMAB INJECTION Combined With Chemotherapy for Nasophapyngeal Cancer

armGroups.label: TORIPALIMAB INJECTION(JS001 )combine with chemotherapy
interventionNames: Biological: TORIPALIMAB INJECTION(JS001 ) combine with chemotherapy

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 1\. Age ≥ 18 years and ≤75 years.
* 2\. Histological/cytological confirmation of NPC.
* 3\. Primarily metastatic (stage IVB as defined by the International Union against Cancer and American Joint Committee on Cancer staging system for NPC, eighth edition) or recurrent NPC that is not amenable for local regional treatment or curative treatment.
* 4\. At least 1 measurable lesion according to RECIST version 1.1.
* 5\. Life expectancy ≥ 3 months

Exclusion Criteria:

* 1\. History of severe hypersensitivity reactions to other mAbs or any ingredient of JS001.
* 2\. Prior therapy targeting PD-1 receptor, or its ligand PD-L1, or cytotoxic T lymphocyte associated protein 4 (CTLA4) receptor.
* 3\. Major surgical procedure other than for diagnosis of NPC within 28 days prior to randomization or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the study
* 4\. History of hypersensitivity to gemcitabine or cisplatin or to any of the excipients.
* 5\. Female patients who are at pregnancy or lactation.

outcomeMeasures.title: IRC-assessed Progression-Free Survival (PFS) According to RECIST v1.1
outcomeMeasures.description:
To evaluate the efficacy of JS001 plus chemotherapy compared with placebo plus chemotherapy as measured by IRC-assessed progression free survival (PFS) according to RECIST v1.1 in all patients.

The definition of Progressive Disease: At least a 20% increasein the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum on study (this includes the baseline sum if that is the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also demonstrate an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. or the appearance of one or more new lesions is also considered progression.

outcomeMeasures.title: OS
outcomeMeasures.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from randomization to death from any cause.

outcomeMeasures.title: Investigator-assessed ORR According to RECIST v1.1
outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the efficacy of TORIPALIMAB INJECTION(JS001) plus chemotherapy compared with placebo plus chemotherapy, as measured by investigator-assessed overall response rate (ORR) according to RECIST v1.1.

outcomeMeasures.title: Investigator-assessed DoR According to RECIST v1.1
outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the efficacy of TORIPALIMAB INJECTION(JS001 )plus chemotherapy compared with placebo plus chemotherapy, as measured by investigator-assessed duration of response (DoR) according to RECIST v1.1.

outcomeMeasures.title: Investigator-assessed DCR According to RECIST v1.1
outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the efficacy of TORIPALIMAB INJECTION(JS001) plus chemotherapy compared with placebo plus chemotherapy, as measured by investigator-assessed disease control rate (DCR) according to RECIST v1.1.

outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the efficacy of JS001 plus chemotherapy compared with placebo plus chemotherapy, as measured by Investigators-assessed PFS according to RECIST v1.1

outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the PFS rate at 1 year in each treatment arm by investigator

outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the OS rate at 1 year in each treatment arm

outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the efficacy of JS001 plus chemotherapy compared with placebo plus chemotherapy, as measured by IRC-assessed disease control rate (DCR) according to RECIST v1.1.
